author: archyworldyscom
title: Paralympic Games 2024 / “Bronze” Christina Gentzou – First medal for Greece (video)
text:
This is Greece’s first medal in the event on the second day of the Games, but at the same time the first medal in the sport of Tae Kwon Do.
The story was written on Friday evening (8/30) by Cristina Genzu Also won the bronze medal at the Paris Paralympics in his sport Tae Kwon Do . That’s all Greece’s first medal in the event only the second day of the Games, but at the same time and the first medal in the sport of Tae Kwon Do which was first introduced at the Paris Games.
The Greek athlete defeated China’s Yinan Yao 14-4 in the 65 kg category (K44 category), putting together a stunning match. Playing smart and hitting on the counterattack, 19-year-old Genju started to accumulate points and took a 12-2 lead with one minute to go. The Chinese tried to react but the match ended 14-4 in favor of the Greeks.
Christina Gentzu’s excitement after the end of the match was evident and celebrated by winning the medal by doing a victory lap with her coach Evangelia Evangeliloglou, holding the Greek flag.
In her first statements after receiving the medal, the 19-year-old athlete spoke of an incredible experience and energy, declaring herself proud to live it. When the journalist asked her what is most intense in her, she typically said that “all the emotions that I have not felt in all my years, I felt them in this event. And sadness, sadness, joy and support … “.
#Paralympic #Games #Bronze #Christina #Gentzou #medal #Greece #video
